body:
Comment 3: 
Hi,

I respectfully disagree that it works as intended.

While it's true that I could type go get -d and then go build -o, why should I do that
when I can clearly just type go get -o.

I'm not talking about the case when I don't know that the package doesn't support
building or not building a command, I talk about the case where I'm automating a deploy
and I know exactly what I'm doing.

So please reconsider this and try and see it from my point of view. Also adding it won't
harm anyone, correct?
